comments.content:
Heroic Condensed, by TypeTrust:  
 [http://typetrust.com/font/heroiccondensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20141225205322/http:/typetrust.com/font/heroiccondensed "http://typetrust.com/font/heroiccondensed")

This article gives details on the magazine's typography:  
 [http://fontsinuse.com/uses/35/esquire-and-conde-nast-traveler](http://web.archive.org/web/20141225205322/http:/fontsinuse.com/uses/35/esquire-and-conde-nast-traveler "http://fontsinuse.com/uses/35/esquire-and-conde-nast-traveler")

Heroic Condensed is close but that's not it. Should be one of the condensed versions of [Graphik](http://web.archive.org/web/20141225205322/http:/typophile.com/wiki/https%3A/%252Fcommercialtype.com/typefaces/graphik), [exclusive for Esquire](http://web.archive.org/web/20141225205322/http:/commercialtype.com/news/updates/new_widths_of_graphik_for_iesquirei_and_ibon_appeacutetiti) and not commercially available.  
As alternative, from the same foundry, [Giorgio Sans Heavy](http://web.archive.org/web/20141225205322/http:/commercialtype.com/typefaces/giorgio/sans/heavy) using the alternate un-spurred /G might work pretty well.
